quiz.question: Which metric measurement unit is often used for newborn baby mass?
What unit measures amount of electric charge in SI terms?
Which SI prefix was introduced to describe 10^-24 and 10^24 magnitudes respectively?
How many grams are in one kilogram?
Which SI base unit did the 2019 redefinition target by fixing the Planck constant?
Which unit describes spectral radiance used in remote sensing often measured in W·sr^-1·m^-2·nm^-1?
Which unit measures luminous intensity in the SI system?
Which prefix represents 10^9 in the SI system?
Which unit expresses area used in astrophysics equal to (10^2) square meters historically?
Which prefix denotes one thousandth of a unit (10^-3)?
Which derived SI unit measures pressure?
Which ancient length unit varied regionally but frequently approximated one-sixth of a Roman foot?
Which everyday unit measures liquid volume in many recipes?
Which imperial unit measures cloth length traditionally equal to 36 inches?
Which rare unit measures nuclear cross-section equal to 10^-28 square meters?
